review: I came here a couple of days ago for my boyfriend's sis's birthday dinner. I've never eaten at cpk before but the birthday girl seemed to really like this place so I looked forward to the dining experience.  Crowded crowded crowded!! The place was crawling with kids! Don't get me wrong, I like kids; but I honestly felt like i was at a chucky cheeses. The line was extremely long; but luckily, we called in an hour ahead of time to put our names on the wait list. Our table was all set when we arrived! :)) - Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese wasn't alllll that. One thing i hate about mac n' cheese is when it gets cold and the cheese hardens up. That pretty such sums up this dish; but in patty form...and deep fried.  - Korean BBQ Steak Tacos were pretty good. The spicy sauce they have on top really brought the whole dish together. On the other hand, just eating the meat alone, it had a consistency of really low grade meat...no bueno :( - Caramelized Peach  Salad was yummm(: i love fruit in my salad and the peaches and cranberries were definitely a hit for me. I think they put a little too much Gorgonzola cheese but other than that, i was still a happy camper! - Norwegian Atlantic Salmon wasn't as great as i expected it to be. The pasta was really bland and i had to add tons of salt & pepper, even lemon juice. My salmon was overcooked and it had a hard layer all around the fish... like they pan fried it for so long the sides turned hard.  Its a sad thing when the salads are better than the entrees. But then again...I didn't try the pizza either..my boyfriend says "you're so embarrassing. Going to a pizza place and eat everything but the pizza is like going to a steakhouse and not eat the steak".  hahaha ooopsies! ill be sure to get the pizza if i ever come back! Or...ill just come back for the Salad ;]
This place is okay. I come here for a pizza and a beer once in a while. They have good appetizers.

We had a party of 3 for lunch on a Saturday. We found the whole staff welcoming. Our server, Christina, was great. She was attentive, without hovering, knowledgeable about the menu, and prompt with her service. We thought the menu offerings were fun, interesting, and extensive. The food was tasty. We had 2 different kinds of pizza, standard cheese, and a mushroom blend. Both were good, not too heavy, and satisfying. These are not to be mistaken for New York quality pizzas, but they were fine for California, and when you need something different than Mexican. We received our second salad the same time as the pizza, and Christina did not blink an eye when we asked to cancel the salad. She assured us it would not appear on our bill. Later the manager came to check on us and to apologize for the late arriving salad. He also assured us that the salad would not be on our bill. Overall, a pleasant dining experience, and we will be back. My wife, a former restaurant owner, gives it a 10.

Sat out on the patio near a heat lamp but was advised that all of the heat lamps are broken. Food was mediocre. Service was poor. May be the last time I dine here. My favs (used to be) their bbq chicken pizza and bbq chicken chopped salad.
The meal was great. I had never eaten in the place always had take out. Service was awesome, meal came out quickly and at the right temperature. The place is not cheap...but worth it in my opinion.

I have not yet dined in at this restaurant but I have gotten them delivered to my home.   California Pizza Kitchen contracts with   for their delivery services which allowed for easy online ordering.  I ordered the Thin Crust Sicilian Pizza which has now been entered my Favorite Pizzas list.  I loved it.  It was phenomenal.  Also ordered the Four Cheese Ravioli which was also good but not world changing.   Overall, food was great although the price were not cheap but were within what I was expecting.  No surprises at the bill.  I would order from here again but probably not on a regular basis.  I will hopefully be updating this entry once I have visited the restaurant itself.

BJ's wait for our party was an hour and a half to two hours!! So, we walked down to CPK and we were seated within 20 minutes! (For a party of 8.) Really helpful when you have 4 little mouths to feed. For our appetizer, we ordered the "Dynamite Shrimp", which was nothing special.  For 4 adults we ordered 3 pizzas and the amount was perfect!   Our pizzas were: 1)  Habanero Carnitas  2) Roasted Garlic Chicken  3) Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage My favorite by far was the Habanero Carnitas!! The habanero sauce that it comes with is SUPER spicy but, I wanted to drown my pizza in it even tho I can't handle spicy food that well. The Roasted Garlic Chicken was kinda dry, so I ended up using the habanero sauce.

We went to the restaurant before for a few times. Just dined there again for my son's bday. Still enjoyed going to this place. Ordered pizza for adults and kids. We all enjoyed it. The pizzas tasted really nice. The service was great, too. I like the wild mushroom with chicken pizza. Kids liked Hawaiian. Would recommend.

I have never been this place. My friend gave me gift card. I didn't expect anythig about this place til i got there,Wow it is nice ,clean  and delicious . I love NEW menu . Taco was yummy. I will come back.

You know you have a YELP problem when you are dining at a restaurant and the second they mess up your order, you shout "People are gonna hear about this on YELP! ya hear me!?"  Okay... so maybe I didn't say that loud enough for the waiter and his crappy manager to hear me, but I said it to myself in character, as I sipped from my watered down tea with melted ice.  I am getting ahead of myself here. The day started with meeting a friend for lunch at California Pizza Kitchen, or as us lazy social networking abbreviators like to say, "CPK". That sounds so LA... ugh!  Anyways, I ordered a half thai chicken salad, with no scallions.  Now maybe this might defeat the purpose for some people, when it comes to their Thai salads, but I am a no onion, no scallion kinda gal... so when I say no scallion, no scallion... capiche?  What does the waiter bring me? a salad with scallions all up in it. I felt as violated as a Kardashian sex tape, as I bit into the salad - and from my lip, fell an oniony flavored morsel... YES, a SCALLION!  At that point, I felt just like Faye Dunaway portraying Joan Crawford in MOMMIE DEAREST.. "NO SCALLIONS! I SAID...NO SCALLIONS!" (yes I reference this movie in yelp reviews a lot, just bare with me).  Just as this visual played perfect in my mind of yelling this to our waiter, he was nowhere to be found. Gone Baby Gone, Without A Trace, Bye Bye Birdie, like every bad titled tv show or movie that I had ever seen, he was MIA (and bad singers too).  A good 6-8 minutes (which felt like 30) passes by and along comes the manager to ask how everything is and fill up our drinks.  I tell her about my salad, (which by this point, I have just started eating and taking out the scallions). She then asks if I want to replace it, and I tell her, it is ok, I will just pick the rest out, being I had picked a bunch out already...plus, we had to catch a movie and time was ticking.  So, when my bill comes, she doesnt give me the salad for free, like most chain type restaurants would, she deducts just $3.00 from the salad (a $9.50 salad).  Mind you, I also purchased food for my children. It is not like the bill would have been a zero balance, if she took the salad off.  I still was going to pay for other items. I just found it kind of a bummer that instead of just crediting the half salad for their mistake, she basically wiped a measly 10% from my $30.00 meal.  At that point.. I just wanted to get up and say "YOU CANT HANDLE THE TRUTH!" or go into some sort of ROCK OF AGES / TWISTED SISTER "We're Not Gonna Take It" dance routine with my fellow dining patrons behind me all the way out the door.  One can dream, but my salad, on the other hand... like the wise guys from Good Fellas, can "sleep with the fishes"...  Too soon?  RIP Henry Hill As the great Donnie Brasco once said, "it's a fugazi"... CPK... "forget about it"... (and the bad kind of forgetaboutit, not the good)  The End.

One of the better places attached to this mall. Bright interior and consistently friendly people--even during the rush times.  Of course, most people come here for the pizza but hey they have good pasta dishes and appetizers too. Try the white bean hummus. It's very tasty and with a smooth consistency. It was a real treat.

My family and I have been going to this CPK for a couple years now. We've gone to the Valley Fair and Santa Monica (Promenade) locations as well, but this is our favorite spot (Oakridge). The food is always great and comes out quickly, which can be a lifesaver when you have 2 hungry little kids.  The staff is PHENOMENAL. The hosts always greet you with a smile and seat you faster than what they quote you (if there's a wait). There are two managers, Andy and Kimmie, that always check on the guests to ensure things are going well. They are very friendly and you can tell that they enjoy their jobs! Since we do go there a lot, we usually ask for Cole or Ginger. Both are attentive and always on the ball. Our drinks get refilled before we finish them, even when it's a packed house. They're both great with our kids and easy to talk to. They make it feel like a neighborhood restaurant, which is the main reason why we come back.  My wife loves the new menu and I LOVE the new TVs. Keep up the great job!

we love the one in palo alto and stanford and i always order the same thing. we just moved to los gatos and thought we'd give this one a try. mistake. cheese pizza- my 12 year old said it was dry and tasted like cardboard garlic fettucine with chicken-bland and dry hubby's fettucine -bayou? shrimp, etc..way too spicy my ginger dumplings..lacking flavor and spicy hot. $60 wasted on a blech dinner. we wont be back.

AMAZING FOOD. +Greek pizza +Spinach artichoke pizza +Fish tacos +Red velvet cake Omg I can't remember them all. Didn't get 5 stars bc of the waiter service. Super slow every time I'm there. But this time the chef or manager or someone came out to check on us and he was awesome! He knows how to take care of customers. Would definitely come back here again! I don't care if the service is slightly slow, the food quality is excellent. (especially compared to Valley Fair CPK)
Always had a great time at this location.  Food serving time after you place the order is reasonable and the "kung pao speghetti" is something to drool for.

Wife, baby and I got there on Friday around 6:30 pm. We asked how long for a table, 15 minutes. Other customers came after us and they were seated before us... Couple with kid(s), 3 teens were seated before us and we had been waiting for 10 minutes before the teens.   I asked the girl who was running the waiting list why everyone got a table before us? She said" You are next..."  We walked out of the restaurant.  What do you expect when you have teenage girls running the front?    The funny part is that they were wearing a T-shirt " We have a new Attitude..." poor service and a bad attitude!

I really like this place. The good is very good and not expensive. The service is great. Our waitress last time was so cheerful and nice, The manager walks around making sure everyone is OK. I always enjoy our meals here.
I got one of those fruity drinks that I couldn't even finish. The food wasn't good today. We came during dinner and it wasn't that busy.

CPK is one of my go to places for food when I'm at the mall. It's a good restaurant and not too pricey. Plus they have one at almost all the malls I like to go shopping at such as Valley Fair and Oakridge. They have more than just pizza too. You can get a great salad, sandwich, or pasta. Whenever I come to one of their restaurants I get my usual.  Tortilla Spring Rolls - thai chicken and baja chicken Wild Mushroom Pizza or Thai Chicken Pizza Those are my usual dishes. I love the peanut sauce. GOT TO HAVE IT! Well on my most recent trip I went to this Oakridge location. Great service and fast! Here's what we ordered: Tortilla Spring Rolls - of course!  White Corn Guacamole + Chips Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza Wild Mushroom Pizza Garlic Cream Fettuccine with Mushrooms All the food was good! Is it me or are the pizzas here bigger than the ones at Valley Fair? The fettuccine was really good! I recommend all their food.  My only complaint is that the complimentary bread they give is cold, like they were storing in the fridge cold. What?

Have been going here for years, but not any more. Went for dinner last night with my parents and during the whole dinner we had 2 flies buzzing the table the whole time.. Inside!  Told the manager and she just laughed it off and that it happens and they get someone here monthly to control the bugs.  she obviously wanted out of our conservation and quickly left to go hang out in the kitchen. Lost out business for good.

Have been going here the past few years and the service has been noticeably declining the past year but we continued to go....I will STOP going now!   I have probably experienced the WORSE service at any restaurant I have ever had.  From the server to the Manager.  This was Sat down on the table.  It took such a long time for someone to get our order.   I am not sure if it was a new guy, but the male server seemed a bit unprofessional. When our appetizers came out the drinks follow.  Once the drinks came out, the water was being served to the group and the server spilled the water all over me and another guest.  Ok, thankfully it was not hot beverage.  However my nice sweater and jeans were soaked.  So what shocked me,  disappointed me and was completely appalling, was the following events.  Keep in mind this happened in front of the bar/cooking area, where several servers, cook  and even the Male manager, wearing a blue shirt, saw the whole thing because I looked right at all of them. 1.  Not once was or ever offered a towel or napkins, I had to get up myself and go to the bathroom and get paper towels to dry myself. 2.  No one came to dry the water off the table, I did it myself with the help of my group. 3.  When the manager finally did come by, his only question to us was how is was your food?  Really, how was the food?  I couldnt taste it because I was wearing ice cold jeans and a drenched shirt which you guys did not offer a towel for me to dry. 4.  When the final bill came out, there was not mention of a comp, removal of an appetizer or even an apology from the manager! This was absolutely appalling.  I can not believe the service and how we/I was treated at California Pizza Kitchen.   What used to be a decent place to go has took a turn for the worse. The Management and service was really horrendous here when I went Saturday night 12/15/2012.   Did I need to get something spilled something on me that was hot or worse, have food spilled on me to get an apology of some sort?

BBQ chicken pizza for about $13 is what I order here every time I visit. It is by far the best thing on their menu. I also recommend the spinach dip but instead of eating it with the chips, try it with the bread they bring. Delicious! Another added bonus - they bring out bread and butter while you wait. Although the bread is not anything mind blowing, it is very nice to have and still tastes pretty yummy. One day maybe I will get adventurous and try some other type of pizza here (emphasis on the maybeeeee) but until then this place is always a trusty tasty place.

If you come to California Pizza Kitchen, you don't come here to eat pasta or salad. There's a Bucca di Beppo next door if you want pasta, and one of those vegan places inside the mall next to Target. I don't recommend one of those pizza/salad hybrids either; the presentation just looks awkward and I think pizza and salad belong on two separate plates. Since you came all the way to CPK, you should a pizza. They're sliced into quarters, and some of them come in the honey wheat crust variety. I had the Spicy Chicken Chipotle last time, but only because I wanted to try something new. Normally, I would recommend the Pear Gorgonzola or Thai Chicken or Jamaican Jerk. They are CPK's staples. Everything else that I've tried are a step below it. If you get dessert, get the Red Velvet Cake with vanilla ice cream, and make sure you  share with a friend. One slice is too big for just yourself, so for $8.25, you want to spread the happiness with your fellow man. In terms of just its pizza, this CPK is good. Of course there's better, Papa Murphy's Take and Bake for one, but for a sit-down pizza dinner with friends, CPK will do. Just be careful because it's pricey. There were 11 of us, and we ran up a ~$240 bill including tax and the 18% gratuity. If you're anticipating large parties, it wouldn't hurt to go to Costco in advance and purchase a few $100 gift cards for $80 apiece.

The Asian Pear Martini is the truth, try it you won't be disappointed!  The food is pretty darn good too. Being a true Italian, I usually go for the Sicilian, but today I ventured on the wild side and ordered something other than pizza (gasp). They offer their own version of a chile relleno which was pretty good- although I cannot in good conscience call it a chile relleno- stuffed chile is a better description as it isn't fried. I also tried the Pear Gorgonzola Pizza (my sister's order) and found it to be surprisingly good for a "salad-hybrid" deal- I would order it again. I do have my favorites- the Sicilian (of course) and the BBQ Chicken- this has to be their signature dish- it is that freakin good!

We came and ordered the Tuscan hummus appetizer, avocado club egg rolls and the Sicilian crispy thin crust pizza. Boy, was the latter a mistake or what.  The Sicilian pizza was tiny, hard as rock and barely edible. It was one of the worst pizzas I have ever eaten.  The pizza was supposed to be a thin crust one, but it was really a one layer thin sheet, which came out so hard. It was just so awful. On the other hand, the appetizers were okay. The service was great, but the food was just not up to par. It was very disappointing and we were left dissatisfied.

California Pizza Kitchen's modus operandi is to take classic (usually great) meals and destroy them. How can you destroy a pizza you may ask yourself? Well, all it takes is one bite of CPK's lettuce topped abomination to make you understand. I'll just get a normal pizza you say! Prepare your mouth for a tasteless piece of cardboard with an aftertaste akin to drinking the toxic sludge of a North Korean nuclear reactor. CPK's take on what they call "food" left me struggling to understand how so many of the world's greatest dishes could be so thoroughly and mercilessly destroyed.  On a side note they now have a Gluteen free menu which makes the vomit spewing from my mouth a little bit healthier.

So I know everyone's been to CPK and know exactly what they serve and everyone thinks they're just OK. My husband LOVES CPK, so we come here pretty often. I think CPK is a bit more than just OK (at least this location). They've up'ed their service and the quality of the food tastes alot better then they did before. They've also added quite a few new items to their menu and made it more healthier. I love all their pizza's. There is one that I remember specifically, their Habanero Carnitas pizza. It comes with a side of seriously spicy sauce. HOLY COW. My mouth was on fire but it was still tasty, just needed a few glasses of water to go with that :) I don't know if I was preggos and easy to please, but I also thought their chicken garlic creamy fettuccine was fantastic. I was really craving garlic pasta sauce that day and it hit the spot - right on! I completely devoured it without putting down my fork.  I don't know if its a new thing, but the last couple times I've been here, the chef bought out the food to our table. The same chef would also come by our table during our meal and ask us how the food is and comment on it if we had any questions. Nice touch. Good job CPK!

I usually don't review chain restaurants but CPK is a good alternative to the other chain restaurants in Oakridge Mall. I do like their thin crust pizza, jambalaya pasta and their spinach and artichoke dip.  Service was pretty good for the lunch time rush.
OMG! The pear-Gorgonzola pizza is killer! I could eat it for a week straight.

Interesting food. Lots of thin pizzas, and some good pastas. great for all ages. my kids love the kids mac n cheese curly pasta with edamame... casual dining. can get very busy sometimes.  my only complaint is with the take out...every single time without fail, they forget either my bread, or my salad dressing and/or my utensils even i after i request and make a big deal to remind them...  some great pizzas:  pear Gorgonzola pizza BBQ chicken Meals:  king pao speghetti with shrimp!!! salad : waldorf salad thai crunchy apps: spring rolls new spicy crispy shrimp  been going here since they opened, ive never eaten something i didnt like...

I always come here for lunch with friends, since its a cheery place and the food is great. I usually order the margherita pizaa, which is always good. Sometimes the service isn't amazing, but you don't pay a whole lot, so its expected. Good for take out or dine in, which ever way you want it, you're going to enjoy your food!

Went here on a Friday night, and when the wait for Cheesecake Factory was too long. Glad we did! Hadn't been to one in a long time and yet to try this one since we moved here. The waitress was extremely friendly and attentive!! The food turned out great too. The only compliant was the large parties that hovered over the other people in their parties as they say waiting for the rest of the long booths to open up. Seemed rather rude in their demeanor to the manager and I know they were trying to take care of it.

I know CPK is overrated to most people but there's always the favorites like Thai chix pizza, Asian chix salad, and my ultimate fav Chix Tequila Fettuccine. This place in particular is conveniently located in the mall. Wish they had access from the inside like Cheesecake Factory.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  They earned an extra star from me just for the fact that they now serve warm bread.  I have complained about this for many years.  They used to serve cold bread with unsalted butter.

First of all I am a die heart CPK fan but this location needs to be taught in customer service. Their hosts were rude short and need to learn that sarcasm isn't always as flattering as they think it is. Me and my fiancé came to eat mind you I'm 8 1/2 months pregnant and seemed like the city of San Jose had to shut the strip mall at 830p we get there and the manager on duty Erik seemed to be very inventive and sits us immediately but then the hosted make a comment saying "oh I wish I had slammed the doors on your face." I personally thought it was rude and very unnecessary to be said. Overall I believe if they teach their hostes customer services they would be alright.

I went there on a lunch date and we were not impressed with our meal. My daughters noodles with alfredo  sauce was not tossed in the sauce and it was hard to tell at first if there was even any sauce at all.  My friend and I shared a california club, and a margarita pizza, neither were good. The club was the worst.  I have been a customer for years and this was my first experience with the one on Blossom Hill. I don't hold it against the restaurant that the food was mediocre. It is a flaw with the Menu. I would go back and order my usual the Pear and Gorgonzola pizza.

It's been a while since I was last here, and I've had no complaints so far.  I shared a pizza with my friend and we split it as the Southwest Chipotle Chicken and The Works. The Southwest Chipotle Chicken was surprisingly good. It came topped with tomatoes, corn, beans, and chicken. I really liked the mixture of toppings. The Works was topped with the normal things likes bell peppers, sausage, tomatoes, etc Both tasted great. You can also order the regular pizza to be on flat bread. I had a hard time eating it because the toppings made it too heavy to pick up the slice! Used a knife and a fork, but I don't mind!  Anthony was our server. He was very nice and sweet. He came back to check on us at the right times and refilled our drinks. Thanks Anthony! Another thing about this place is that it has TVs around the top of the kitchen. One of my friends enjoyed this because he'd rather watch the game than listen to a bunch of girls talk.

I always find a craving for CPK. I love the Thai Crunch salad, it is one of my favorite salads of all time, it's probably not the healthiest, but it is so delicious and refreshing! Fried mac n cheese! Thai Pizza! and RED VELVET CAKE! I don't think I can say anything is bad at CPK!

Went there on a Sunday around 1:00pm Party of 3. Seated right away. Somehow they screwed up our order. (Though they didn't tell us how.) It took a while to get 2 personal pizza's and a salad. But they gave us 20% off.  Without even complaining. Service was good.  Food was good.

God I just love this place so much.I've always had a craving for there...everything!Theres great service, always checking on me and really considerate when I change my mind. It's so hard to only have one thing here! The food is always great, and that keeps me going. It's fresh, the only food I haven't tried there is the fish because I hate fish. But everything else I have tried and have never been displeased. In the long shot, I've never had a bad experience.:)

My boss and a couple of my co-workers came here to treat me out for my last day of work. The environment was very casual and pretty elegant, considering the fact I thought it wasn't a sit-n.  The waitress was friendly, but it was down time (so not a lot of customers). I ordered the 4 cheese ravioli, I thought the sauce was pretty tasty until my coworker said it's sweet like ketchup. It made me think twice but overall, even though the portion seemed small, it really filled me up
Their Harbanera Salsa was awesome. I would just come to this place for salsa.

I don't know what to tell you.  I came here for our friends birthday dinner I just simply asked the waitress for their best seafood dish.   She brought the most delicious seafood pasta I've ever had. Yummmm.   I'm going back!!

Great Hosts/Hostess. We were assigned a Table within 8 minutes of arrival on a busy Friday evening, after a long 8 hour drive from the LA area. Great Pizza. we ordered the Original BBQ Chicken, The all, Chipotle and the Chicken Pineapple BBQ Pizzas. The waitress was great too. She graciously took our orders, brought us drinks and bread appetizers to get started. My wife and daughters loved this place. Pizzas tasted great! My wife ordered a side Caesar salad. Tasted good. The only reason I would not give this CPK a 5 star rating is for the simple fact that their side small white plates for our bread appetizers were dirty. You could see the black spots that appeared like grease, but nothing to worry about. Again our waitress quickly got those plates off the table, replaced with new plates and we were off to a great dinner. I highly recommend that waitress checks all plates and utensils prior to placing anything on the Table, just to make sure everything is clean. I would go back again to this place in any case!
Love their food and good service. Most of the time, the wait is not too long. During weekends, the parking is a pain.

I have eaten most of the pizzas and they are delicious to the fullest taste that you can be able to swallow and have your taste buds experienced. The restaurant itself is very passionate with all of the art designed on the boxes that they have for to-go meals. the service is very friendly and has the least amount of errors when it comes to getting the drinks served and getting the food prepared at a steady pace. The temptation to getting an extra order of pizza is always happening when i come and eat due to the pizza being so delicious i always contemplate to take some extra to-go.

I recently started to like CPK. The first time I went there, I wasn't all that thrilled with the food but the more I go, I took a liking to the place! My son and my daughter- 4 and 2 love it here because it's kid friendly, they give you bread and butter which is their fave and mine and my husband's while we wait for our delicious food. The kid's menu is great also.  We always order a full salad and one or 2 different pizzas and it's more than plenty of food. They also have beer on tap- what's better than pizza and beer?! I love their cobb salad- actually all of the salads are great and the pizzas are great too. Love that they give you unlimited amount of bread- which is freshly baked!

It's been a while since I've eaten here and since I was in the mood for some thin crust pizza, cpk came to mind. We came here about mid afternoon so no lunch rush to deal with and was seated right away. Since we were quite hungry, my bf and I ordered a spinach artichoke dip, thin crust California Club, and the chicken tequila fettuccine.  Our appetizer came out first (of course) and it was yummy. The dip wasn't thick like some places and it had a good consistency. My only negative feedback about this is the piece of artichoke heart in the dip, and the messy playing (dip spilled over the bowl). Those should be cleaned up before serving.  Our server also brought us some bread with (I'm guessing) rosemary olive oil. Let me tell you, the dip tastes really yummy with the bread! Next came our pizza and Alfredo. The pizza looked humongous because of the salad on top. It looked like a healthy pizza. I love the nuttiness of the arugula paired with some iceberg salad tossed in ranch. The bacon was cooked to perfection. It had a nice crunch with out the greasy fat or burnt taste. And the chicken melted into the pizza dough with the cheese. It was a nice combo, but a bit messy to eat.  When I first saw the Alfredo, I noticed the green pasta and thought it was a tad strange. As we tasted it, it had a perfect balance of flavor with a good hint of lime. It also had some sautéed onion and bell pepper which balanced the dish extremely we'll. Normally, we aren't fond of bell peppers because of how thick the cuts are (the flavors are very predominant). However in this dish, the peppers were julienned and brought great flavors without overpowering the dish.  Overall, everything was really yummy and we would definitely come back.  PS the mango iced tea and white Caribbean sunset sangria are delish! I'd recommend the mango iced tea! It has a really nice balance and not too sweet. *posted some pics of our food!

The CPK here now has wi-fi, (been so for 2 months) so that's a plus from the other CPKs. Their orders are just as good as any CPK that I've been in, and at lunch and after lunch time, there isn't much people, so it's an ideal place to choose if you want some peace of mind with you or a small group of friends. Mmmm... mac and cheese here is delicious.

Service was crappy  but the manager totally made up for it. For the first part of the meal I would have had a better time flagging down an airplane then our server. Manager was totally apologetic when he saw us trying to get a server and after that it was smooth sailing.  Usually CPK eats... lettuce wraps, flatbread... but  I tried the pear pizza with arugula (it was pretty nomz) and the hubby tried the pasta (it was decent). Other folks got their usual (cheese, BLT and chicken bbq). Overall will come back eventually.
Awesome customer service from Kaila. Will definitely be back here again! The two dishes were prepared to perfection! Awesome place & warm environment.

In the past, I would have given this restaurant 5 stars for their service alone.  They would have you seated right away, have bread and water on your table within 2 minutes, have your order within 5 minutes, and have your order on your table within another 5-7 minutes.  I held them as the standard for some restaurants that were near me with lousy service, that I gave up on.  Unfortunately, the service at CPK has slackened off dramatically.  I've now sat trying to get a waiter's attention, or my order, for extremely lengthy periods of time, while watching the manager standing, chatting away with 2 men at a table right next to me.  Now, I have to ask for items multiple times, and have had some frustrating experiences.  Once, in the past, my waiter asked if I'd like the rest of my salad boxed up, which I had about 1/4 remaining.  I told him yes, but when he wanted to box it himself, I pointed out what looked to be an eyelash, and said I didn't want that in my salad, since he wasn't letting me box it myself.  I wasn't actually complaining; however, next I knew, the waiter brought me out a boxed up full salad that was freshly made to take home.  That type of service for even minor issues, was impressive.  Now, CPK seems to be lacking in their past service, and don't seem to do much to make up for their much lower level of service or issues.  But, because of their much higher standards in the past, I'm averaging them out for now.   As for the food... it is good.  Some good salads, some unique pizzas, and I like their new cedar plank salmon.  Because parking at this mall is atrocious, I will most often call in an order and park in their 10 minute spaces, and pick up the meal.   I'm sad to see CPK's former superior service drop so much, as I think of great service as a very key component of the dining experience.  I'm keeping their rating at a 4 for now, in the hopes that it is just a blip, and will soon be back up to scratch.

The service at this CPK is horrible. It seems like they make their customers wait on purpose to make it seem like their place is busy. Last time I was here, I saw at least 4 available tables by the front desk. After waiting for 30 min (I was given a 15-20 min waiting time), I realized that these tables were still not being used, so I asked if they were reserved. The waitress told us they weren't and told us that we would soon be seated.  We were seated after 45 min and found out they were trying to squeeze the 4 of us into a small table that usually seats 2 people. I asked if we could have one of the larger tables but our request was denied. We eventually ended up leaving and eating elsewhere where we got a much better service.  Save yourself a trip here and eat at other restaurants nearby.

I've always been a big fan of CPK.  Their food tastes great, is reasonably priced, and I've never experienced bad service.  This time, however, I got sick from their pizza. I went to the CPK at the Oakridge Mall a couple of weeks ago for lunch, and overall I had a great experience.  However, several hours after eating there I started to feel sick, and ended up with food poisoning for the rest of the day.  I ordered the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken pizza.  I'm sure that I got sick from eating this because I hadn't eaten out for several days prior, and shared the exact same meals with other people who didn't get sick.  At CPK, I was the only one who ordered this pizza, and I was the only one who got sick. I definitely won't be eating here again.
By far the best pizza I have tried (in the USA). Try the extra thin whole grain crust. Wild mushroom one is to die for. Tiramisu is awesome too.
I have gone here many times. The thin crust pizza is tasty, and most of the other entrees are good. The service is usually great, although on occasion there have been issues.

I recently went here for lunch with a friend and I always order the California Cobb salad which was good but I've noticed their "half order" has gotten much smaller and a "full order" was the size of what their half used to be only 6mo. ago.. The reason I note this is that the prices have not decreased but the amount of food for the price has. Might start looking for a new favorite Cobb salad

This is one of our go-to places for a dinner date when we can't decide on anything else.  Never a long wait, service is pretty good - no complaints except that we often have to ask for bread.  Some of my favorite menu items include their BBQ Chicken pizza (on a regular crust), the Tostada with chicken, and the California Club (with mayo on the side). I am also fan of their Red and white sangrias. The bf loves the Jamaican Jerk pizza and Sicilian. The Butter Cake (w ice cream) is a must - make sure you save room for this! We are knocking off a star because they have taken some of our favorite items off the menu such as the Korean BBQ Tacos, the Mango Tandoori Chicken Pizza and the Chicken Walnut Salad Sandwich :( Located at the mall - parking sucks.

This place has become my new: "once a week, after work, too tired to cook or go out meal." The mrs. and I always get the same thing because this place is really good at consistency. However something I recently noticed is bothering me...my pizza is always cold or room temp. I call for take out or pick up often. They quote me 10 mins for pickup. One time I decided to call them outside of their establishment and walk in and wait for my pizza but my pizza was somehow ALREADY miraculously cooked and they were waiting on the salad...? So having thought that was strange I did it again... again the pizza was ready WAY before it should have been. BOTH times the pizza's were room temp when I opened the boxes after walking out of the restaurant.  I'm pretty sure they cook their pizzas before hand and then warm them up for take out... uhm.. is it really hard to cook pizza's to order? If I'm wrong I apologize but I'm almost certain something is up. It's hard for me to be mad -- the food tastes good -- but it's cold / room temp and pizza should taste like it was just made (also piping hot!).

Love CPK!!!  Great place to go with family.  Kids meals are fun and the pizzas are delicious.  I especially love their selection of salads.  When I don't feel like cooking I order by phone and get curbside pickup.  Nice and easy and everyone is always happy.  Love having this place in our neighborhood!!!

It shouldnt be but... pizza my heart is much better than this place in terms of pizza. The service here at around 8pm was a little lacking in attention. Appetizers were somewhat bland (I had the corn guac and caprese) and the pizza was.. well it was different in terms of ingredients but really, its nothing special. However I do appreciate the ambience of the restuarant. Too bad it smells outside though. Anyways, I was a little disappointed when they ran out of tabasco sauce.
good pizzas, always order the spinach dip to start with.. avoid the pastasssss
Delicious salads, but ridiculously over-priced. Also, a very long wait time.  Almost worth the wait.
WOWZA that chicken tequila fettuccine is delicious! Don't be afraid to order it because it's a pizza restaurant... I honestly thought it was better than the BBQ chicken pizza.

I haven't been to CPK in years! I was invited by a colleague for lunch and was impressed with the quality of service and ambiance. Parking was a bit of the challenge, as it is most of the time if you're going to Oakridge mall. I drove around for about 10 minutes during lunchtime before I eventually found a spot. When I arrived, the waitress brought out mini slices of bread and oil for dipping. The bread was fresh and warm, I practically devoured the whole plate as I waited for my collegue to arrive. We started off with the ceasar salad, which was standard but good. I decided to order a pizza, given that it's their specialty. I opted for one of their original hand tossed pizza - the Wild Mushroom because I love mushrooms and it was highly recommended on Yelp. It comes with four types shaved cremeni, shiitake, white, Portobello mushrooms with mozzarella and pecorino romano cheeses. I love meat on my pizza, so I was happy to hear that I could add chicken to my pizza. The pizza was delish and the chicken was moist and soft, not overcooked or dry. The portion was big and I had a couple of slices to bring home for left overs. Overall I was happy with my choice and wouldn't mind coming back here again.
I LOVE CPK. My mouth drools every time I step into the restaurant. 5 stars, all day everyday.
Nice location, good service and good food.  There hasn't been a dish that I've been disappointed in yet!

This place gets 4 stars because of it amazing catering service!  You can place your order online and set a specific pick up time and they always are on time! It is super convenient!  I don't eat in the restaurant too often but the staff that I have dealt with is pretty friendly! They also have a "pizza dough" card that you may sign up for that gets you free little gifts such as appetizers or small plates, even free CPK money if you accumulate enough points!! Be sure to sign up its FREE!

Well, of course I can only rate a chain restaurant like CPK a 3-star, especially since I've had some really good pizza in my life like Chicago deep dish pizza, and a few great NY pizza slices. As everyone else does when they go to CPK, we always order the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza (rate a 3/5) for $13.59. I remember it being a lot better when I was younger. Not sure if it just had something to do with this particular location that we visited about a week and a half ago for my little brother's college graduation celebration. Anyway, it's the standard order when we go to a CPK, which by the way, we haven't visited one in like... over 2.5 years. Anyway, the other pizza that I really like is a lesser known one, the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza, which is listed on the thin-crust pizza section, but you can get it hand-tossed, which is what we did. I'd rate this pizza a 3.5/5, and it costs the same as the BBQ Chicken Pizza ($13.59). The Jamaican Jerk has a little bit of a kick to it, which we like. With all of the pizzas, we like to order a side of ranch to dip our crust, because the crust by itself doesn't taste like anything. We went with a group of 11 people, and each of us pretty much ordered an individual pizza, so we definitely ran the bill up. I personally think that the pizzas are a little pricey at almost $14 a pizza for 6 pretty small slices. But I guess that's just inflation.  In terms of service, our server wasn't the best. She didn't really know much about the pizzas and she definitely wasn't in the best of moods, and it didn't seem to put in an extra effort handling a larger group. Oh well, I guess.  We probably won't be going back to a CPK for a while, but I always enjoy those 2 pizzas, even though they are a little expensive in my books. Service could certainly use an upgrade, but all in all, CPK is always a fun, casual location to hang out with family and friends.

This is the second time I've gone to this restaurant. Last time, I had a sandwich that was pretty decent. This time I decided I should have one of the pizzas. Since the word pizza is in the name of the restaurant, you'd think those would be particularly good. Wrong. I ordered the Hawaiian (my favorite and a simple one to make so it should be good). What I got was extremely disappointing. Barely enough ingredients to cover the bland sauce underneath. The ham was sliced so thin there were holes in it. There were probably a total of 8 small pieces of pineapple (1 per slice). I think there might have been some cheese, but didn't have my microscope with me to verify. The sauce had absolutely no flavor. To top it off, it arrived cold. It seemed as though it had been sitting on a table in the back area, placed on a cold plate and served. I started eating it because I was with friends and didn't look at it closely when it arrived. After a few bites, I just stopped eating and talked to them instead. I brought the leftovers home, but tossed it in the garbage. Overpriced and under delivered.

Have been to CPK a few times here and there, this one I think has the best service of the ones I've been to. Went in Yesterday to have lunch. The host was super friendly and helpful, I couldn't find parking which is always a pain at this mall(ughh!) So I parked in Curbside and asked the host if that would be a problem since I was stopping in on my lunch break. He said it would be fine, he would keep an eye out and sat us by the window. (Very much appreciated)  Our server (Sam) Very attentive, nice and helpful. (Good server)  put in our order quickly since she knew I had a limited time for lunch. Our food came out pretty quickly. The small plate of avocado and sweet corn is by far one of my favorites. I didn't care too much for the Chinese chicken salad. But the chicken tequila fettuccine is always amazing..

Came here on a Friday night for dinner with two other guests. Standard CPK fare and service -- very friendly and attentive. This review is more for the location. This CPK is located in a busy mall in San Jose, so parking was a tremendous pain. I think it took about 20 minutes to park during prime dinner time. (There is valet parking for $8 though.)  If you are close with your group members, I would recommend having someone go and put your name in for your table and order first, so the food can be in the works by the time your driver finds a spot. (However, if not pressed for time, this won't apply to you.) Great service, good food, reasonable prices -- just the parking is a pain!

Went here for Lunch on 7-25-14 The parking Really stinks at this location so my wife and daughter were dropped off to go get a table. Took me 20 minutes of circling before I got a spot. My wife and daughter had all that time to look at the menu and still were not sure what to get. Our server was named Cole and he was amazing. He was so nice and helpful. He took the time to explain all of the pizza and told my girls to be adventurous and try the Avocado pizza which had some salad on it. It was definitely not my cup of tea so I got the standard thin pepperoni pizza. The girls also got a small wedge salad that all 3 of us shared and it was the perfect amount. We had way more food than we needed. Every bite was better than the next. They loved the wild salad pizza and my boring one was also great.  Very good food and the Best server I had had in years.

Omg I love this place! I love the different pizzas and variety of toppings they have. Every time I come here it's always satisfying. Their lettuce wraps are the best!!! I will not go anywhere else for lettuce wraps. They're so fresh and the meat mixture isn't overly salty.
Very good food. This place has delicious pizzas and salads.  The only problem is that its a little on the expensive side. But I will go back again despite the price. Service was excellent.

BBQ chicken pizza was dry and flavorless with only 1 small piece of chicken per slice? To their credit they took it off the bill after the fact but ruined our dining experience :(. Sonoma chicken coop way better BBQ chicken pizza! Skip this place!
Love thin crust Jamaican jerk pizza.  Very flavorful and nice spice kick to it.  I recommend. Also the salted caramel pudding dessert is amazing.  Service was great too.

We had our 6th years old son birthday there and it was a blast,  we didn't know if a room full of kids at the restaurant will be a good idea, but it was worth it.  The person in charge of the party was the best, she kept the kids engage at all times,  the tour of the kitchen was awesome and the ice machine to a group of 5 & 6 yrs old kids was amazing, but for them to make their own pizza and eat it was by far the best part. Overall I would recommend it to parents who are looking for something that's fair price and lots of fun for the kids. We will return again for dinner and parties.

It's been awhile since I've been to a CPK and the madre has become obsessed with it lately. Love starting out with their sourdough bread and olive oil herb concoction. Signed up for their rewards program to get a free starter and $10 off a $40 bill! Sweet! We ordered the thai chicken pizza (really more like vietnamese? peanut sauce, bean sprouts, cilantro?), cobb salad, sausage bread, and the jambalaya pasta. Everything was really good, although it took awhile for the food to come out as we accidentally requested for everything to come out at once. Service was great, drinks were constantly refilled. Would come back but wish they would bring my favorite, white garlic chicken pizza back!

I came on a Saturday evening with my boyfriend and ate a light dinner here. The hostesses were so nice and helpful. I got the BBQ chicken salad and held the cheese and asked for the sauces on the side. My server, Emily, got my order to the t. She was great and the salad was too  10/10 would come again!
We come here a lot. The food is scrumptious the Service has always been really good as well. They are very polite and helpful . Always accommodating and willing to make costumers happy!
There is almost never a wait when the other restaurants on Blossom Hill keep you waiting... forever! Skip Olive Garden or Cheesecake Factory and just come here!

I actually love eating at CPK.  I love their menu and their food.  However, it recently came to my attention that they do not use GMO-free ingredients.  This is a deal-breaker for me.  When the day comes that they change this practice and are transparent about their corporate policies regarding food safety, I will gladly revise my review to the 4-5 stars that they would otherwise deserve!
My first visit to a CPK was in Vegas. I was hooked because if the food. High quality, just the right amount and unique dishes. The staff is well trained, make ng you feel welcome and special.

I nice different take on pizza. The Californa Club pizza is awesome! It's like a salad pizza (in a good way). The Thai Chicken Pizza is also one of my personal favorites. Food is great and I've never had bad service. Best pizza place around!

Very good pizza, very good drinks, and very good service. Mind you, I'm usually alone here for my breaks, so I'm at the bar since it's just me. The food definitely takes awhile (even when it's slow) but the quality is always top notch. The only reason I didn't give 5-stars is because there's ALWAYS this 1 bartender (glasses, short haircut) who's always rude and looks like he doesn't like anyone there (it's an uncomfortable situation). And the handful of times I've been there with family, we've almost always had to flag down a hostess or manager because our waiter/waitress will disappear
I love this place... specifically the pizza barbecue or thai. The pad thai spaghetti is good ,but if you don't like spicy just tell the server to make it mild or not at all.

Not my go to spot for pizza, but since we were in the area and it was getting late I decided to dine-in.  I had an order of the baja chicken tortilla spring rolls for starters and pizza for the main course. The appetizer was the best part of the meal, the guacamole it came with was awesome.  Unfortunately the pizza was not that great, probably a bad selection on I choice but when I ordered the waitress added "good choice". It was far from it, the actual pizza isn't the problem cause it was seasoned well but the sauce ruined it, just overpoweringly sweet.
Such a great environment  love their pizzas and the spinach artichoke dip  yummy!!! Service was o-k but no worries

Cheers to my 100th review!!!!  CPK was not our first choice for dinner but I'm glad we had a change in plans and ended up here!  It's located at Oakridge mall next to Cheesecake Factory and Forever 21. The entrance is outside. There's a lot of parking but if you go around dinner time, parking may be a bit hard to find since there's also a movie theater here. So plan accordingly!  This location is really small compared to the other restaurants in the area. You can call in and make a reservation although on busy days they won't take it. You have to show up in order for them to write your name down. They are very nice and understanding. We had a party of 17 and they did their best to seat us within 45 minutes.  To start off the night, I ordered the mango strawberry cooler. It was one of their new drinks. It tasted very refreshing. There were strawberries and a like slice on top. I wished this drink had free refills though! Hint hint**  I decided to have pasta instead of a pizza. Which is very unusual since I love pizza! But I made the correct choice with my four cheese ravioli! It was delicious! I cleaned the whole plate! I also got to taste me friends white sauce pizza with bacon. That was delicious too! Next time I will order their pizza for sure!  I really don't have any complaints for this place. The service was pretty good considering we had a large party and it was very busy as well!  A 4 star from me! Keep it up CPK!

I got the flat bread, which was actually an appetizer so not that much food for lunch. I'm not crazy about the price to food ratio. The flat bread itself was very tasty-mushrooms and various cheeses on a paper thin crust.

Brought my family of 5 here for dinner to be competly disappointed. We have always LOVED the California Pizza Kitchen at Oakridge. We were on the west side of town and decided to give the Valley Fair location a try. This location does not serve some of the all time favorite items including the raviollis along with the tiramisu. After we ordered and waited 15 mins we asked for the bread we normally enjoy at the Oakridge location and we were told they had no bread. I was sitting with 3 starving teenagers for 35 mins. The waiter said he would bring his manger, which she told 20 mins to come to the table. when she arrived her attitude was OUT OF THIS WORLD, she was sarcastic and practically yelling. She stated that the bread is a free/complementary item so I basically should not be suprised by the fact that they are out. When I asked if there was anything (chips/crackers) they could bring for the kids to snack on until the food was ready, as we had been waiting quite some time and the kids were very hungry. She said I was welcome to order an appetizer, which would then need to be made in the kitchen. I went on Yelp to look if this location has these types of reviews. The manager looked over at my phone screen and then stated "Don't threaten to write a review on Yelp". This highly upset our grandmother who said that we did not say anything, but we do have the right to write a review on yelp. We asked that the manager not return to our table because her attitude and tone of voice was aggressive at the point. She returned to our table twice after that. Firstly time to show me the time that our order was entered in there system, then she came to deliver our food. I guess it was the mangers way of making herself feel in charge. We ate and quickly left. On our way out we noticed a few other tables were having issues. One demanding to speak to a different manager. My family will avoid CPK at Valley Fair at all costs.

CPK is a bit overpriced, but I think the food is tasty. In particular I think their lettuce wraps are the best I've ever had. Another good tip is to take advantage of their "small plates" menu. We usually order 3-4 of theses along with an order of chicken lettuce wraps.  The BBQ Chicken Pizza is their best and signature pizzas. The cilantro adds a nice touch and the BBQ sauce is a tangy compliment.  You also can't go wrong with the Sedona Tortilla Soup.
I like the servers here. They are hella friendly and accommodating. Although, the price is a bit overpriced, I still like the food :)
We got Bianco from the flatbreads. This I liked very much. But the two star is for the jambalaya which lacked salt and taste.

Came in around 5:30pm on a Wednesday evening. Got seated right away & got our orders taken. I ordered their new drink which is the strawberry mango cooler, it very refreshing. Especially for this hot summer weather.  As my entree I had ordered the four cheese ravioli, I usually go for their regular chicken pastas but I thought I should give this a try.  At first glance the plating seemed a bit small, looked like 10 pieces of ravioli. It seemed more of a little snack for me but I suppose it was a good portion. The seasoning and the overall taste of it was very good. Highly recommended.  Also got the red velvet slice as dessert, opted out for the optional ice cream side. The red velvet was nice and moist & was a decent sized portion. The frosting is delectable as well

CPK typically doesn't disappoint. If you like great salads and fun pizzas, it is definitely a good spot. Because it's a chain, you grow to expect the same things at each restaurant. One of those things is good service. The food at this restaurant was great, everything was amazing. I love all their salads and their pizzas are so unique and trendy (even if I always want the BBQ chicken).  Our experience here was pretty poor. We had no problem until after we ordered our dinner. Our server never came back, and we were left without drinks, then without a bill, and had to go in search of someone so we could pay. It really was disappointing. We ended up contacting the bartender and were given our bill, paid, and left, all without coming in contact with our server. Just bad!
There hasn't been something on their menu I have tried and not liked!!!! Great salads! Pizzas! And the pasta dishes are great (especially the shrimp zucchini fettuccine)

Had lunch at this location today... Moroccan chicken salad and a coffee... sadly I got food poisoning...this is the 2nd time from this chain different locations I have gotten very ill... I'll spare you the details but it has been a horrible day and it was 19.00 w tip... not cute. Server was good but kitchen not so much!

I've been here multiple times and never had a problem but I recently visited again for lunch and was very disappointed. Nothing against the food itself but maybe the communication between kitchen and other staff. Our waiter was distracted and inconsistent. We had to try and flag him down since he wasn't very good with checking in with us and had to wait forever even to get a water refill. When my mom was ordering her food she asked for a salad with grilled shrimp. He even said "okay a salad with chicken" no sir... I said shrimp. And he repeated it back the second time, "Okay great, a salad with shrimp." So you would expect it to be right once it came to the table. Nope, instead it still had chicken. So we had him take it back and get shrimp which took a while because it had to be grilled. Second time around and now there was no dressing on the lettuce. Instead of apologizing and saying he would fix it, he just laughed and said huh, weird... And then walked away. Hopefully next time all that is avoided, because we do love the food!

Came in to Cpk Friday night after about 6 months of not dinning here. My family and I were avid fans of this location for many years but after our last experience I will not be going back. First and for most the whole staff has done a complete 360. The food had always been mediocre but the staff had always been the reason why we returned time and time again. We came mostly for Joyce and Ginger. Both amazing bartenders with the sweetest dispositions. I can't even begin to explain the service we encountered this last weekend. I will not mention a name because I'm not in the business of getting anyone in trouble, but for one we sat for nearly 10 minutes without even so much as a acknowledgment. Once we were greeted our drinks took another 10 minutes. Not to mention our waiter knew nothing about the menu and it showed. Our appetizers came out the same time as our food and all he could say was it happens like that quite often. WTH. On top of that my family and I listened to a whole conversation  our server was having with another co worker that was not only inappropriate but rather offensive. We then proceeded to ask about our two favorite girls and our waiter told us that one had moved to LA and the other was fired and proceeded to tell us the story as if it was breaking news. I'm sorry but a simple they don't work here anymore would have sufficed yet they continued on with this defamation of character that made me feel almost uncomfortable. Little did they know my family and I still are loyal regulars of hers. Between the tardiness of our food and the lack professionalism we asked to speak to a manager. But it seemed as if we were being rushed out of the door by our server and we're told the manager was very busy and then another server came over to ask if there was anything they could do for us. We're we supposed to believe that this young child like girl was the manager. We payed our bill and left never to return. If your really craving CPK I recommend the Valley Fair store. My 2 stars are only for the few crew members that still remain that remind us of why we came back  in the first place.
California Pizza tastes great, it is a good place to go if you are near Oakridge Mall.

Gave California Pizza Kitchen a try last week, food was alright, but the proportions you get for the price is not worth it in my opinion. I ordered the thin crust California club pizza with a pint of beer and it came out to over $20.00! I wouldn't really mind paying this amount, but the pizza itself was just alright in my opinion. The ingredients were actually really fresh for the most part, but it was lacking flavor and it didn't have as much of a crunch to it as I would have liked.  As for the service that too was okay, it was a bit crowded when we went so our food did take a little while to get to us, but our waitress Rebecca was a really sweet so we didn't care too much.  I'll probably end up trying CPK again in the future, but right now it's a pass for me.

We just did the kids make your own pizza and pumpkin decorating.  So much fun for the kiddies and adults relaxed with a margarita, salad and chicken wrap.  Fantastic experience!  Thanks CPK team :) :) :)

Yum to the scampi shrimp pizza "limited time till January 2016" get it before it's gone:) it has there lemon garlic sauce with mozzarella, Romano cheese, shrimp and arugula salad on top it was just delicious! I'm mosdef gonna get it again and I also got their strawberry mango spritzer it was so good. Too bad not refills. Good dinner
Good pizza (California club is amazing) and the Mango Mojito is incredible!

I love CPK. We used to go to the CPK close our home almost every weekend. They changed their menu of that CPK, they got rid of my favorite Tiramisu, that discouraged me from going to that CPK. This CPK is little far for us, so instead of going to CPK every week, we go there once in a while. I have tried all the veggie Pizza and Pastas, Salad and Soup here, I can't complain about anything, its always awesome. My all time favorite is Chipotle Chicken Pizza with No Chicken :) and Tiramisu.

Came here during lunch rush hour on MLK day. Mall was insane. California Pizza Kitchen was packed but they sat us within 10 minutes. We sat down and were ignored for about 10 minutes. We finally flagged down a waitress to ask if they can take our drink order. We asked for water and she said she would bring it right out. All of the waitresses looked stressed out. Two managers were walking around helping pass out food to customers. One of the managers noticed us and asked if he can take our drink order and said our waitress would be right with us. We were a bit confused since we already ordered our waters. Anyways, we said we were ready to place our orders. He was very pleasant, and took down our orders. The waitress came back with our waters and said, sorry, I know our manager already took your order. Sorry about the other waitress but I guess I will be your waitress now. Your food will be right out, is there anything else I can get you? We told her no, we were fine. As a customer, I have no idea what is happening behind the scenes. Although its apparent, everyone looks stressed out, we have not officially met our waitress who is suppose to be assigned to us- and how were we suppose to know? I thought all of that was unnecessary. Just give us our drinks, and our food. The waitress was very pleasant, and nice the whole time. Service was ok- we did not need a lot of the explanation of  another waitress who was suppose to be serving us or the behind the scenes miscommunication, blah, blah, blah. I don't know about the customer service today, it was kind of all over the place, but they got it together as the restaurant slowed down.  Food was alright. I ordered the tortilla soup and the italian sandwich. I guess it is my fault for not ordering the restaurants specialty- pizza. My friend enjoyed her chicken caesar salad. The Italian sandwich was gross. The sandwich was flimsy and I wish I had ordered something else. I probably should have returned it, and ordered something different, but I ended up picking at the sandwich and only eating half (not including the bread).  Maybe my taste buds are changing as I get older, but I am just not too crazy about CPK anymore. Food is overpriced, and not worth, mediocre food.

Tired from shopping and just want a place to grab dinner? CPK is an A-OK choice!  My family and I were looking for a place to eat while shopping around Oakridge Mall and we decided to eat at CPK. It was a Saturday night and the wait was about 30 minutes which isn't as bad compared to the wait at Cheesecake Factory. Although, they seemed disorganized. One of the waiters said we were ready to be seated, took us to our table and then told us she made a mistake and that our table wouldn't be ready in about 10 more minutes. When it was really our turn to be seated, we were given menus without the drink menu. Our waiter came and introduced himself, noticed that we didn't have drink menus and kindly got us it. After a few minutes, we ordered and waited for our food for about 15 minutes. During our wait, we had some on-the-house fresh bread to dip with herb olive oil. The waiter was kind enough to get us more after we were done! For our order, we ended up getting the Thai crunch salad, Sicilian pizza, BBQ pizza, wild mushroom pizza and the chicken tequila fettuccine.  The Thai Crunch salad was really good. Not the best salad I've ever had but it had the crunch of the ingredients, topped with thai peanut dressing that was delicious overall.  Out of the 3 pizzas I ordered, mine and my family's favorite was the BBQ chicken pizza with its sweet & tanginess. The Sicilian pizza and the wild mushroom were both tied for my 2nd favorite in different ways. The Sicilian pizza was basically a meat pizza with italian sausage, spicy capicola ham & salami. It was delicious but was a little bit too oily. Also, for a thin crusted pizza, it wasn't as crunchy as I would have liked it. The Wild Mushroom pizza is a definite pizza for mushroom lovers/vegetarians. I thought it was really good but my parents didn't like it so much so I guess it depends on the person. It was also a bit on the oily side as well. Overall, all the pizzas were pretty good but I wish they were baked a little longer because most of them came out soggy.  My favorite dish here was the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. I finished this dish up fast. The jalapeno lime sauce was a perfect sauce to go along with it. It added a tangy taste to the spinach fettuccine. I definitely would recommend trying this dish here!  Overall, my experience was average. Our waiter was really nice but I think the staff needs a little bit more work on organization. The food here is mediocre but it's a nice place to eat when you're at the mall!
Standard CPK. We're a fan of their pickup service and their salads. Get the cob salad and add beets! Sooo good.

Came here on Saturday night for dinner with my family. Our waiter Frank was absolutely the best! He made us all feel welcome and had the sweetest demeanor and friendliest attitude! And he made us laugh too! Of course the food was to die for, but Frank's amazing service made this experience a million times better! We've definitely been here before, but after this experience, we are definitely coming back again and again! Thank you so much for your positivity and peppiness!
Not at all a fan after our late and cold and expensive delivery tonight....I highly recommend shopping elsewhere for quality delivery pizza...Domino's would have been infinitely better...

The service has been very pleasant. Our server is very sweet and genuine. The host and hostess were very personable. It was going to be a 45 minute wait, so I let them know we would wander the mall and be back in 30 min. They took my phone number just in case and called about 15 min later to let me know the table was ready. Service was 5 stars.  The food was really bland. It was a bit on the pricy side for the quality and serving size. It's too bad. The service makes me want to come back, but the actual food just wasn't exciting. Will not return :(

This was the worst experience I have had at a CPK ever. I understand it was busy, but this time there was no excuse. Our server, Amanda, was completely rude and had no undertanding about asking for more bread or drinks. My food never arrived and my family had to ask to have their food reheated becaue they were waiting so long to eat and have parmesean and pepper which also magically never appeared along with our waitress who happened to never walk by. When my food finally showed up, it was the most disgusting thing I had tasted there. It was bland and earthy and a noodle had a long strand of something black, something not included in the dish. Our table was also extremely crowded because our waitress never picked up any dishes. We will not be coming back.
Food was terrific.  The service was even better. Despite being very busy, we were well taken care of!!

I had a wonderful experience this morning.  I came in today around 11:50am and Andy helped me out.  Andy was very friendly and professional, he made me feel very welcomed which I Love.  Also, two other managers came to make sure I've been helped. On my way out the hostess girl was very nice, smiled, also friendly and thanked me and said goodbye. Then the gentleman working there named Kellen open the door for me.  Kellen is very sweet and made my experience here a great one.  Made my day. Thank you.

Conveniently located on the perimeter of the mall, it is definitely a good family type of restaurant. Do they make great pizza? I'd have to say yes! Are the other dishes up to par? I'd have to say unfortunately not. Don't get me wrong, I don't think they are capable of serving you a bad dish, but there are a couple of dishes that are just missing that "WOW" factor. Here is today's line-up: The Works (Pizza) Roasted Artichoke Spinach (Pizza) Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings Four Cheese Raviolis The pizzas were on point! No doubt! From the crust, meat, and artichoke hearts & spinach, everything was assembled and baked to perfection! Now moving on to the to the other dishes... The dumplings were decent, but the sauce that was drizzled on was a bit salty, and there was a little too much of it. I know the sauce also add's to it's presentation, but unfortunately it's consistency. The raviolis were cooked perfectly, but the cheese within was more bland than tasty. I was hoping it was just the first one I tried, but after eating my 3rd rav, it just didn't pack enough flavor for me. Our waiter was very friendly attentive, but he seemed a bit flustered at times. With a party of 14 it is understandable, but we found ourselves asking for things repeatedly. Luckily everything came out in a timely manner, so our overall experience here was a good one. Conclusion:  It is a convenient place to hit for pizza when you are in the mall, and are not in the mood to deal with the crazy food court crowds. I know that many of us our bummed that Pizza Studio is no longer open in the food court, but luckily we still have a great pizza place to fall back on!

Chicken Thai Lettuce wraps: 5 stars. Delicious and super flavorful Pizza: I forgot the name of the one I got. But it had pepperoni, mushrooms, and sausage. It was good but I'm not a big fan of thin crust. If you like that, then this place is for you. I actually prefer pan pizza like Pizza Hut or Domino's. I know. Boring.  Spinach Dip: Yum! Big fan. Cheesy and not too salty. Red Velvet Cake: It tasted good and we only got it because there was a special and we got it with our meal. However, I wouldn't pay for it. I'd much rather go to Cheesecake factory and get their Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake!
shrimp lettuce wrap was AMAZING! and the service was great with 5 kids and two adults

I went for Mothers day dinner and they got us seated immediately which was 1 star! Food came out supppper fast which is my reason for 1 more star. (I was expecting a wait like BJ'S or something similar). My total came out to be $40 including Pasta, Pizza and a small plate... Considering it was just $40 im not too annoyed. Reason being is their food was just a D+ on the scale of portion, and taste. If i were to come back i would probably just stick with Pizza! All in all it was very mediocre. I really wanted to like this place

Located in the mall, this place isn't somewhere I would go even if I was shopping in the mall and needed something convenient. It's just one of those places I don't understand...pizza, pasta, and such would seem simple enough but it just doesn't hit the spot for me. Oily pastas?  Cardboard overpriced pizzas? Burnt chocolate desserts? I should have known by the empty restaurant during dinner time that I should have turned back. Unfortunately I had a $50 gift card to get rid of, so I finally put it to use and ordered a shrimp scampi, hawaiian pizza, cheese pizza, and chocolate souffle. It took about half an hour to receive our food. It was time to dig right in and like I said, oily super bland pasta, cardboard pizza, and burnt chocolate dessert...I'll pass.
This place offers a fun, festive place to dine with family and friends. The selection is great. We come here very often for gatherings and office events. The lettuce wraps are amazing!

CPK is a place I'd normally not venture. I needed to spend my gift card. It's nice that it's family & kid friendly. And of course pizza is one of most kids' favorite things to eat. The two times here with my son have been good experiences. Waiters and hostess were all nice and provided great service.  I wasn't feeling like having pizza on any of the times here. The first time I ate here with my son I chose the Jambalaya Fettuccine. It is one of their pasta items. It is described as blackened chicken and shrimp, crawfish, andouille sausage and tasso ham in our spicy cajun sauce. I really liked the flavors. Normally I don't eat spicy but their sauce I could handle. All the many shrimp were big and the crawfish were thankfully de-shelled. So those crawfish aren't too noticeable. Sausages were more visible. Fettuccine noodles were al dente. Good and consistent both times. They give a separate kids menu along with crayons. My son chose Hawaiian pizza and Fresh fruit. Second time around he chose the BBQ Chicken Pizza and also Fresh fruit. Fresh fruit are sliced pineapple and halved red grapes.  Size of our non-fat yogurt smoothies were huge. Definitely a large cup. We chose Mango & Strawberry Banana. Both were good too and made us full.  Thank you for the few September nights off of my typical dinners at home and having a break from washing dishes and cleaning the kitchen. Tips to my servers were well deserved. Thank you again California Pizza Kitchen team!
Pizza place close to my house ordered to go . pizza came fast over all every thing was excellent.

Boss invited our team out for a casual lunch and decided pizza would be a good choice (pizza is never not a good choice!) Easy parking and no wait was definitely a plus - which is pretty rare for a restaurant at Oakridge. The free bread was pretty good, with a side of herby olive oil. I ordered the lunch combo - 7" original BBQ pizza with a Mediterranean side salad. Salad had garbanzo beans, which I'm not a big fan of, but it was good overall. Portion size is big - I was stuffed more than my pizza was! Lite strawberry mango fresher was also tasty! Very fizzy.

Too many times we are looking for what is wrong with a business!  I have to tell you what a fun. We had with Therese the bar tender that was not afraid to make recommendations and her manager Deanna!   They made us feel welcome and visited with us!  They had a tremendous amount of clients and to go orders and still took the time to make sure our dinner was just perfect!  Loved it and we will be back!  We had the prime rib think behind the crust!  No wait! Dinner was great and so was the sangria flight!
Foods amazung customer service needs work went in yesterday megqn the host needs a promotion

Service is great. Stopped in for a quick bite this afternoon and a glass of wine. I enjoy munching on the Shaved Mushroom and Spinach Flatbread.  I paired it with Coppola Pinot Grigio. Perfect for an afternoon treat.  Sit at the bat for quick, attentive service. Say hey to Charles~

I've had CPK a few times in the past, mainly because some friends like the chain and they order for take out now and then.  I finally decided to try it for lunch.  I ended up really enjoying it. We weren't very hungry so my wife and I ordered the Asparagus & Arugula Salad, Buffalo Cauliflower, and the Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti to share.   First of all, the complimentary bread and olive oil dip was excellent.  The bread was warm and had a great texture.  The dip was a bit heavy on the rosemary but good nonetheless.  The salad was on the small side but tasty and had some good fresh ingredients. The cauliflower with the buffalo sauce was good but at $8, could have used a few more pieces. The best item was the pasta. The rolled pasta had great chewy texture, plenty of wild mushroom, and tossed in sauce with perfect amount of seasoning.  The Arnold Palmer had the right balance between lemonade and iced tea also.  Our server, David, was fantastic. He had several tables to take care of, including a large party, but seemed to be everywhere at once. We were also impressed with the fact that he split up the pasta dish for us without even being asked.

First of all, it's at Oakridge Mall, so parking is scarce especially around the restaurant area. My best recommendation is to park elsewhere and just walk there. Target has a parking structure and it's kind of nearest to most of the restaurants.  Anyway, we went at lunch time, 1230-ish and it was not busy at all. We got seated right away and our waiter was Noel, Noe, couldn't really see his name tag, something like that. Regardless, he was really attentive, greeted us with smile, told us about some of their drinks that they, and lastly, he came by checking up on us often and refilled our drinks without being asked. My sister-in-law ordered the Spaghetti bologanese (?) something like that, basically spaghetti with meat sauce (not pictured) but she normally likes it as she always orders that. I didn't try it. I had the Garlic Roasted Chicken Fettuccine and it was delish! It was just the right about of sauce, not too garlicky, and not too overwhelming. Really creamy and absolutely delicious. The bits and pieces of chicken was a little underwhelming, I felt that some pieces were dry and just didn't taste good. For an extra $3. I was better off without the chicken. The pizza was good. I don't like pineapple, so I didn't have any of the Hawaiian pizza, the mushroom, sausage, pepperoni pizza was good, although, the meats made the pizza a little salty. I didn't enjoy that as much.
